title: Crashes on gitlab search
content:
Everytime I'm using omnisearch from gitlab ("/" key) tab crashes which lead to forcing firefox to restart.

I tried to troubleshoot by going to about:profiling, it appears that tab goes 100% cpu.

What I tried :

  • new profile
  • Refresh firefox
  • no addons mode
  • reinstalling
  • Trying with firefox beta 142.0

Doing this on Firefox 141.0 (aarch64) on a Macbook M2 pro sequoia 15.6
creator: pagnat7

title: Amazon often freezes and won't load pages
content:
Hi, I have a Windows 11 Home 64bit and I am using the latest version of Firefox 141.0 64 Bit.

This issue isn't just on the latest version though, it's been happening for a long time and i can't seem to find why.

I will click on my Firefox bookmark and the page will show up fine as normal, quite often, I will then click on a link within the page and nothing happens, I can see at the tab it's showing it's trying to load, but this just stops after a while. I don;t get an error page etc.. it just stops and goes no further.

This issue seems only to happen on Amazon.co.uk I don't seem to have this issue with any other site, which is odd, as it seems an issue specific to that site.

If I leave it a while, eventually the link will just start to work, and then the rest of the site seems fine, then out of the blue, it might start doing it again.

I have tried things like clearing the cookies for the site, clearing cache etc but still seems to happen.

Does anyone know what it could be?

Regards James
creator: james_uk

title: storage\default is 2.65G，can I exclude it when backup my profile? (Self rescue for Beijing Firefox close)
content:
Hello, Beijing Firefox is closing. I have to sync my data by myself. I know some options. But only one is suitable for me. Other suggestions are welcome.

1. Use Firefox global account. My network to global account may be not reliable. 2. Self host Firefox sync server. Too complicated 3. Travel my profile manually. Easy for me, and may be automated by my home computer which is a WebDAV server.

I'm using 3. But I find a big folder "Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\fgrfgcgt.default-release\storage\default" It is 2.65G which is a bit big. I can exclude/delete it from my auto backup?
